properties.comments: High value habitat. Low densities of fish (not sure why). Abundant gravels, deep pools, undercut banks, and small woody debris. Extreme areas of algal growth. Cattle impacts extreme throughout.

Fished from approximately 35 m downstream of bridge up to the middle of the bridge. Stop net at the bottom. Exact same site as 2024. Bottom of site wp 430.

properties.comments: Entire site was moatly dewatered with only 3-4 spots even fishable. One fish captured in deepest “pool” (see pool photo).

properties.comments:
Site is intermittently dewatered with significantly less water than last year. Still many fish caught - all in deepest pool located on left bank approximately 3m upstream of the flagging.

Total area wetted was estimated at 5m2.

properties.comments: This is the same site as 2004. Electric fishing was conducted and fish 60 mm or more were tagged. Slightly less water than last year.

properties.comments: Nice, low gradient, extreme with significant low down throughout. Very difficult walking so much of the survey was conducted outside of the banks then visit to the stream where measurements were taken intermittently for the 600 m that was assessed. Wide flood plane with defined walls, approximately 15 m high at 45°. Healthy Liberian, consisting herb and shrub with sparse spruce forest that appears to have been impact your bar since they bark disease with dead and fallen.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments: Very nice dream with good flow. Significant precipitation last night so could be running higher than typical for this time of year. Abundant gravels throughout and abundant cover in numerous forms present. No barriers observed. EDNA sample taken at bottom end of site.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card
Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments:
Large stream with complex habitat and cover available as deep pools boulders, lwd, swd and undercut banks. There’s a canyon section approximately 100 m long located 100 m upstream of the bridge on the Modeste FSR where there are multiple cascade steps up to 1 m with deep pools downstream. At top of site - stream is bouncing off steep gully walls.          Abundant gravel present suitable for adfluvial and resident rainbow trout, as well as bull trout       

See eDNA site or water quality information.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments: Surveyed from Finley FSR down to the map location of the reservoir. At the time of the survey was still streamed character. Abundant gravel throughout with cover available. Numerous run sections suitable for rearing for juvenile works out and rainbow. No barriers observed.

properties.comments:
Landslide at 300m upstream of tracks - Wp208

Low gradient stream with abundant gravels and numerous fish to 60 mm observed. Entrenched steep wall Valley with several sections where clay banks have collapsed into the stream. Surveyed to railway Calvert.

properties.comments: Beaverdam’s begin approximately 150 m downstream of the culvert within in sized gully. Damn range in size from .62 near 1 m in height. Upstream of the dance are abundant, gravel, and areas of shallow pool and small wood debris suitable for. Par and juvenile rearing

properties.comments: Moderate size stream with abundant gravel and habitat, suitable for fry and juvenile someone rearing with shallow pools, small wood debris, large wood debris, and undercut thanks. Low gradient with no fish and no barriers observed.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments: Stream is flowing, but volumes are what must be minimal compared to Channell forming discharge. Very large amounts of algae near to the highway potentially indicating some nutrient inputs perhaps from the mill site upstream however, farther downstream the algae is less thick. Large areas of gravel suitable for Chinook and sockeye spawning if there was sufficient flow during periods of spawning. EDNA site at the bottom end of survey.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments: Channell D watered at tone assessment, shower pools located at the very downstream end of the site. Abundant gravels throughout suitable for Chinook and sockeye spawning flows were suitable at the time of spawning. Likely some deep pools present when stream is flowing.
properties.link_method_site_card: Link to Methods for Site Card

properties.comments: Stream D watered until approximately 360m upstream of the railway culverts. Farthest downstream pool contained numerous fraud where EDNA sampling was conducted. Upstream of where occasional pools began flows increase towards the top end of the site where continually flowing Channell remerge. This is an extremely large system With high flows and fresh at based on the size of the substrates. Abundant gravels present throughout the entire area with little woody, Dupree and cover present at low flows really only in the interstitial spaces between cobbles and folders.

properties.comments: Abundant gravels throughout with no barriers between the road and the lake. Larger stream with good flow. Occasional shallow pools and sparse large wood debris and small Woody be thank you.

properties.comments: Low gradient stream with abundant gravels and cover available as Boulder‘s smaller debris, large debris, undercut banks, etc. Good flow and no natural barriers observed in area survey

properties.comments: Nice stream, fairly steep with numerous steps from large Woody debris between 40 to 60 cm in height. Murkiest shallow pools to 30 to 40 cm deep and folder and ledger cover throughout.

properties.comments: Good flow, steeper stream with numerous step pool steps of 30 to 50 cm and shallow pools 30 to 40 cm deep. Pockets of gravel present suitable for resident boat, trout, spawning and abundant large Woody debris throughout.
